segment.source: Monitor Windows Defender ATP onboarding
segment.target: Monitor Windows Defender ATP onboarding

segment.source: Monitor the onboarding of the Windows Defender ATP service to ensure your endpoints are correctly configured and are sending telemetry reports.
segment.target: Monitor the onboarding of the Windows Defender ATP service to ensure your endpoints are correctly configured and are sending telemetry reports.

segment.source: Monitor Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding
segment.target: Monitor Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14322 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14322 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: You can monitor the onboarding of the Windows Defender ATP service to ensure your endpoints are correctly configured and are sending telemetry reports.
segment.target: You can monitor the onboarding of the Windows Defender ATP service to ensure your endpoints are correctly configured and are sending telemetry reports.

segment.source: You might need to monitor the onboarding if the package did not configure the registry correctly, or the reporting client did not start or execute correctly.
segment.target: You might need to monitor the onboarding if the package did not configure the registry correctly, or the reporting client did not start or execute correctly.

segment.source: Monitoring can be done directly on the portal, or by using System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM).
segment.target: Monitoring can be done directly on the portal, or by using System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM).

segment.source: Monitor with the portal
segment.target: Monitor with the portal

segment.source: Go to the Windows Defender ATP portal.
segment.target: Go to the Windows Defender ATP portal.

segment.source: Click Machines view.
segment.target: Click Machines view.

segment.source: Verify that endpoints are appearing.
segment.target: Verify that endpoints are appearing.

segment.source: Note It can take several days for endpoints to start showing on the Machines view.
segment.target: Note It can take several days for endpoints to start showing on the Machines view.

segment.source: This includes the time it takes for the policies to be distributed to the endpoint, the time it takes before the user logs on, and the time it takes for the endpoint to start reporting.
segment.target: This includes the time it takes for the policies to be distributed to the endpoint, the time it takes before the user logs on, and the time it takes for the endpoint to start reporting.

segment.source: Monitor with System Center Configuration Manager
segment.target: Monitor with System Center Configuration Manager

segment.source: Monitoring with SCCM consists of two parts:
segment.target: Monitoring with SCCM consists of two parts:

segment.source: Confirming the configuration package has been correctly deployed and is running (or has successfully run) on the endpoints in your network.
segment.target: Confirming the configuration package has been correctly deployed and is running (or has successfully run) on the endpoints in your network.

segment.source: Checking that the endpoints are compliant with the Windows Defender ATP service (this ensures the endpoint can complete the onboarding process and can continue to report data to the service).
segment.target: Checking that the endpoints are compliant with the Windows Defender ATP service (this ensures the endpoint can complete the onboarding process and can continue to report data to the service).

segment.source: To confirm the configuration package has been correctly deployed:
segment.target: To confirm the configuration package has been correctly deployed:

segment.source: In the SCCM console, click Monitoring at the bottom of the navigation pane.
segment.target: In the SCCM console, click Monitoring at the bottom of the navigation pane.

segment.source: Click Overview and then Deployments.
segment.target: Click Overview and then Deployments.

segment.source: Click on the deployment with the package name.
segment.target: Click on the deployment with the package name.

segment.source: Review the status indicators under Completion Statistics and Content Status.
segment.target: Review the status indicators under Completion Statistics and Content Status.

segment.source: If there are failed deployments (endpoints with Error, Requirements Not Met, or Failed statuses), you may need to troubleshoot the endpoints.
segment.target: If there are failed deployments (endpoints with Error, Requirements Not Met, or Failed statuses), you may need to troubleshoot the endpoints.

segment.source: See the Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues topic for more information.
segment.target: See the Troubleshoot Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection onboarding issues topic for more information.

segment.source: SCCM showing successful deployment with no errors
segment.target: SCCM showing successful deployment with no errors
